question_1.question: What is the purpose of the Override Data Type feature in ODX?

options.option_a: To change the visual appearance of data in reports
options.option_b: To modify the data type of a field in the data warehouse
options.option_c: To increase the performance of data synchronization
options.option_d: To encrypt sensitive data in the data source

question_1.explanation: The Override Data Type feature is used to explicitly change the data type of a field in the data warehouse, as mentioned in the context.

question_2.question: In which scenario might you use the Override Data Type feature?

options.option_a: When a field with only numbers should be treated as a numeric value
options.option_b: When a datetime field contains dates lower than 1753-01-01
options.option_c: When you need to filter data by a specific criterion
options.option_d: When you want to merge two fields into one

question_2.explanation: The Override Data Type feature can be used when a datetime field contains nulls or dates lower than 1753-01-01, which is one of the example scenarios provided.

question_3.question: How do you set up a general rule for overriding data types at an ODX data source?

options.option_a: By writing a custom SQL script
options.option_b: By configuring settings in the data source's properties
options.option_c: By right-clicking on an ODX data source and selecting 'Override Data Types..'
options.option_d: By manually editing each field's data type

question_3.explanation: To set up a general rule for overriding data types, you right-click on an ODX data source and select 'Override Data Types..', as described in the context.

question_4.question: What must you specify when setting up a rule to override data types in ODX?

options.option_a: The username and password for the data source
options.option_b: The Schema, Table, Field, or Data type where the rule will be applied
options.option_c: The IP address of the data source server

question_4.explanation: When setting up a rule to override data types, you need to specify the Schema, Table, Field, or Data type where this rule will be applied.
